title: Font
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Font**

A font ont is a certain physical form in which a typeface with a certain character set is released by a certain vendor under a certain trade name — for example a set of metal type sorts, a digital font in the Type 1 format, a digital font in the OpenType PS format etc. Thus, a font can be said to be one weight, width, and style of a [typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typeface). Times Roman by Linotype in Type 1 format is one font, Times Cyrillic Regular by Linotype in Type 1 format is another font, Times Roman Std by Adobe in OpenType format is another font, Dutch 801 Roman by Bitstream in Type 1 format is another font — all of the same typeface Times Roman.  
Before scalable type, there was little distinction between the terms font, typeface, and [family](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/family). Font and typeface still tend to be used interchangeably, although the term typeface is usually more correct.

In television production, "font" refers to information, such as a location or a person's name, electronically superimposed on the screen (hence the more common "super"). Also used as a verb: "How should we font this guy?" "You supered him 'convicted criminal;' he's actually the DA."

**Discussion:**  
 [Type Terminology: Systems? Suites? Super Families?](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/node/39843)  
 [Er... what is a font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/node/14701)  
 [Tom Phinney explains the difference between a typeface and a font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2005/12/quality_in_type.html)

**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Publications](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Publications) : Font**

_[Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/www.fontshop.com/features/fontmag/)_ is a [FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontShop) publication serving as both an editorial magazine and type specimen catalog.

Issues 001-003 were designed by [MvB Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/MvB%20Design) ( [Mark van Bronkhorst](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%20van%20Bronkhorst) and [Alan Greene](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Alan%20Greene)) with written contributions from FontShop founder [Erik Spiekermann](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20Spiekermann), Peter Hall and Margaret Richardson.

Issue 004 was art directed by [Joseph Pemberton](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Joseph%20Pemberton) from [Punchcut](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Punchcut) and edited by [Tamye Riggs](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tamye%20Riggs) and [Stephen Coles](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stephen%20Coles) from FontShop San Francisco. Guest designers included cover art from the foundry [Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Underware) and a feature by designer [Marian Bantjes](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Marian%20Bantjes). Contributing writers include [Margaret Richardson](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Margaret%20Richardson) and [John D Berry](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typophile.com/wiki/John%20D%20Berry).

Related links: [Review of _font 002_](http://web.archive.org/web/20140119112623/http:/typographi.com/000166.php "Typographica")
